zombie.name: Patricia
zombie.backstory: RN for 20 years. I loved nursing but felt like I was putting band-aids on bullet wounds. Patients kept coming back with the same chronic issues - diabetes, autoimmune conditions, fatigue that no test could explain. I'd discharge them with more medications, knowing deep down they needed something different. The system was treating symptoms, not root causes. I started studying functional medicine and nutrition on my own time, and suddenly everything clicked.
zombie.dramaticMoment: My wake-up call was watching Margaret, a patient I'd cared for repeatedly over 3 years. Same issues, more medications, getting worse each admission. She looked at me and said 'Why can't anyone just HELP me?' I went home and cried for an hour. That night I knew I had to find another way. There HAD to be a bridge between conventional medicine and true healing. When I discovered integrative health coaching, I finally found that bridge.
zombie.transformation: From frustrated RN watching patients revolve through the system without real healing - to $4,800/month integrative health coach helping women get to the ROOT of their health issues by combining conventional and holistic approaches.
zombie.incomeStory: $4,800/month working 18 hours/week. Started by helping nurses from my hospital who were burned out and chronically ill themselves. Now I have 14 regular clients - mostly women 40-55 with complex health issues that conventional medicine couldn't fully address. Left hospital nursing 6 months ago and never looked back.

writingStyle.capitalization: mostly lowercase, occasional ALL CAPS for emphasis on health concepts
writingStyle.punctuation: uses ellipses..., em dashes, clinical precision with warm accessibility
writingStyle.tone: bridges medical and holistic language, evidence-based but open-minded, uses 'y'all' and 'honestly'
